data.name: ReportSupportRuleInvDeviceExceedsRecLimitController
data.value: The N2 Bus is the Johnson Controls® field communications trunk that links Application Specific Controllers (ASCs) to a supervisory controller. ASCs include the DX-9100, Air Handling Unit (AHU), Unitary (UNT) Controller, VAV controllers, and VAV Modular Assembly (VMA) devices. The NCM can coordinate the activities of all these devices.

data.name: AHUSupplyingCooledAir
data.value: Your air handling units appear to be supplying cooled air to your building while outdoor air conditions are normal for heating. This is an indicator of potential energy waste.

data.name: AHUSupplyingHeatedAir
data.value: Your air handling units appear to be supplying heated air to your building while outdoor air conditions are normal for cooling. This is an indicator of potential energy waste.

data.name: AllUserAccountsHaveAdminPrevilege
data.value: All user accounts of the Metasys system have administrative privileges. Please determine if this is necessary.

data.name: DefaultMetasysPasswordDetected
data.value: The default Metasys user account and password were detected and should be modified.

data.name: HeatingCoolingWasteWhenAHUConditioning
data.value: Heating and cooling waste occurs when the air handling unit is conditioning air rather than making use of suitable outdoor air.

data.name: NoAreaForImprovementIdentified
data.value: No specific area for improvement was identified within Metasys regarding the security of your site.

data.name: NoAreaForImprovementIdentifiedInMetasys
data.value: No specific area for improvement was identified within Metasys regarding the security of your site.

data.name: NoBrokenObjectReferenceFound
data.value: No broken object reference was found within Metasys that should be investigated. A broken object reference indicates that a process (programming logic, schedules, trend studies, graphics, etc.) cannot find an object in the system. The severity of this item depends on the process that cannot find the object it is trying to control.

data.name: NoDirtyFilterNeedToBeReplaced
data.value: No dirty filter needs to be replaced.

data.name: NoDuplicateBaCNetIdentifierShouleBeReplaced
data.value: No duplicate BACnet identifier should be replaced with unique identifiers. Duplicate BACnet identifiers cause communications problems when non-Metasys controllers are added to the network.

data.name: NoEnoughDataComfortAndHealth
data.value: Not enough data was found regarding Comfort and Health

data.name: NoInputPointOnAHUConnectedToSensor
data.value: No input point on your air handling units is connected to sensors that will continue to require regular service checks to ensure that the sensors in your system stay accurate. Without accurate sensory input, your building control systems may waste energy, decrease your equipment reliability and longevity, and cause occupant discomfort.

data.name: NoMetasysAlarmEventShouldBeInvestigated
data.value: No Metasys alarm or event should be investigated and acknowledged. Excessive alarming could be an indication of equipment issues or other underlying root causes that need to be addressed. Or it could mean your alarm thresholds could be adjusted to produce fewer alarms so that operators can focus on alarms that are true indicators of problems.

data.name: NoMetasysUserAccountHasNotBeenUsed
data.value: No Metasys user account has not been used within the last six months. Consider deleting these dormant accounts.

data.name: NoNetworkControllerRequireSecurityUpdate
data.value: No network controller requires security updates to ensure your building automation network remains secure.

data.name: NoNetworkControllerUnderperforming
data.value: No network controller appears to be underperforming based on current CPU and memory conditions.

data.name: NoNetworkControllerUseUnsupportedSoftware
data.value: No network controller use unsupported software that should be upgraded or replaced. Unsupported software no longer receives regular updates to ensure it is protected against the most recent cyber security threats.

data.name: NoOutputPointOnAHUConnected
data.value: No output point on your air handling units is connected to motors, switches, valves, and dampers that will continue to require regular service checks to ensure that these devices continue to operate properly and efficiently.

data.name: NoOverridenPointShouldBeInvestigated
data.value: No overridden point should be investigated and released if no longer needed. Overridden point can be a source of energy waste and comfort issues.

data.name: NoPointTrendedInMetasys
data.value: No point could be trended within Metasys that would help provide a more thorough diagnosis of your Metasys system and equipment.

data.name: NoSpecificAreaForImprovementInMetasys
data.value: No specific area for improvement was identified within your Metasys system regarding the maintenance and reliability of your site.

data.name: NoSpecificAreaForImprovementInMetasysStandards
data.value: No specific area for improvement was identified within Metasys regarding the standards of your site. These can include duplicate BACnet identifiers and underutilization of Metasys productivity features such as authorization categories. Refer to this section in the Site Details for specific issues found on your site.

data.name: NoSpecificAreaForImprovementStandards
data.value:
Ensuring your system follows published standards for Metasys configuration helps avoid issues and helps increase staff productivity through use of advanced features.

No specific area for improvement was identified regarding Metasys standards.

data.name: NoSpecificAreaForReliabilityImprovementInMetasys
data.value: No specific area for reliability improvement was identified within Metasys. These issues can include unreliable points, backup battery issues, excessive alarming, overridden points, dirty filters, overloaded and offline controllers or broken object references. Refer to the section in Site Details for specific issues found on your site.

data.name: NotEnoughDataEnergyPerfSaving
data.value: Not enough data was found regarding Energy Performance and Savings.

data.name: OutdoorAirTempExceededNormalCoolingCondition
data.value: We show that the outdoor air temperature has exceeded the normal conditions for cooling, yet the air handling units continue to provide heating output. This is an indication of potential energy waste.

data.name: OutdoorAirTempExceededNormalHeatingCondition
data.value: We show that the outdoor air temperature has exceeded the normal conditions for heating, yet the air handling units continue to provide cooling output. This is an indication of potential energy waste.

data.name: PercentAHUFanMotorsModulatingOnDemand
data.value: {0} % of your air handling unit fan motors appear to be properly modulating based on demand, saving energy by not running at full speed when not required.

data.name: PercentAHUFanMotorsRunning100
data.value: Up to {0}% of the air handling unit fan motors are always running at maximum speed. Not only is this a sign of wasted energy regarding the fan motors, but it may suggest the air handling unit is not set up to run as efficiently as it could be. Consider adding variable speed drive (VSD) motors that can modulate the fan speeds for more efficient operation.

data.name: PercentAHUNotHaveEconomizerStragey
data.value:
An economizer regulates the amount of outside air to bring into the building to reduce the load on the cooling system.

Up to {0}% of your air handling units do not have an economizer strategy. Economizer strategies can save up to 30% of a building’s total energy consumption when implemented properly (http://aceee.org/files/proceedings/2014/data/papers/3-1007.pdf). Consider adding an economizer strategy to this equipment as appropriate.

data.name: PercentAHURunningWithoutResetStrategy
data.value:
A reset strategy is used to reduce the air handling system capacity to the minimum necessary level in order to improve energy efficiency.

Up to {0}% of the air handling units on your site are running without a reset strategy.

As seasons change during the year, peak cooling loads of a building also change. Yet most systems run 100% of the time at a fixed set point which causes overcooling and reheating to occur resulting in excess energy use. A reset strategy helps to ensure the supply air temperature and static pressure set points of your air handling units are reset at appropriate times of the year.

data.name: PercentAHUUseEconomizer
data.value: {0} % of your air handling units use an economizer strategy, which provides energy efficiency benefits.

data.name: PercentAHUUseResetStrategy
data.value: {0} % of your air handling units use a reset strategy, which provides energy efficiency benefits.

data.name: PercentEquipmentFollowingSchedule
data.value: {0} % of the HVAC equipment that is controlled by Metasys appears to be following an implemented schedule, helping to avoid energy waste when the building is not occupied.

data.name: PercentHVACReqNotScheduled
data.value: Up to {0}% of the HVAC equipment controlled by Metasys does not appear to be scheduled, which may mean it is running when the building is not occupied. Adding schedules can result in a significant reduction of a building’s energy use.

data.name: PerformanceReviewConducted
data.value: A performance review of your Metasys system was conducted on {0}. During this review, approximately {1}% of your site was evaluated. This report contains a summary of the results.

data.value: {0} specific areas for improvement were identified within Metasys regarding the security of your site.

data.value: {0} specific areas for improvement were identified within Metasys regarding the security of your site.

data.name: PluralBrokenObjectReferenceFound
data.value: {0} broken object references were found within Metasys that should be investigated. A broken object reference indicates that a process (programming logic, schedules, trend studies, graphics, etc.) cannot find an object in the system. The severity of this item depends on the process that cannot find the object it is trying to control.

data.name: PluralDirtyFilterNeedToBeReplaced
data.value: {0} dirty filters need to be replaced.

data.name: PluralDuplicateBaCNetIdentifierShouleBeReplaced
data.value: {0} duplicate BACnet identifiers should be replaced with unique identifiers. Duplicate BACnet identifiers cause communications problems when non-Metasys controllers are added to the network.

data.name: PluralHVACEquipmentDeviatingSetPoint
data.value: {0} pieces of HVAC equipment in your building may be deviating too far from desirable set point conditions. This may cause issues with comfort or temperature-dependent processes.

data.name: PluralHVACRequirementIsScheduled
data.value: While {0}% of the HVAC equipments in your building is scheduled, consider reviewing those schedules on a regular basis to ensure they still meet the needs of your facility.

data.name: PluralIndicatorHVACEquipmentDeviatingSetPoint
data.value:
Providing productive environments for building occupants or critical processes is a key function of any BAS system. Metasys monitors temperature and airflow and automates the control of equipment to maintain the desired conditions for your facility.

There are indicators that {0} pieces of HVAC equipment in your building may be deviating from desirable set point conditions. This can cause overheating or overcooling of zones. In addition to causing comfort issues or disrupting processes that are temperature dependent, this overheating/ cooling can also be a source of energy waste. It could also be an indicator of equipment issues such as leaking valves, failed electric reheat coils, faulty damper linkages, or faulty sensors.

data.name: PluralInputPointOnAHUConnectedToSensor
data.value: {0} input points on your air handling units are connected to sensors that will continue to require regular service checks to ensure that the sensors in your system stay accurate. Without accurate sensory input, your building control systems may waste energy, decrease your equipment reliability and longevity, and cause occupant discomfort.

data.name: PluralMetasysAlarmEventShouldBeInvestigated
data.value: {0} Metasys alarms or events should be investigated and acknowledged. Excessive alarming could be an indication of equipment issues or other underlying root causes that need to be addressed. Or it could mean your alarm thresholds could be adjusted to produce fewer alarms so that operators can focus on alarms that are true indicators of problems.

data.name: PluralMetasysUserAccountHaveNotBeenUsed
data.value: {0} Metasys user accounts have not been used within the last six months. Consider deleting these dormant accounts.

data.name: PluralNetworkControllerRequireSecurityUpdate
data.value: {0} network controllers require security updates to ensure your building automation network remains secure.

data.name: PluralNetworkControllerUnderperforming
data.value: {0} network controllers appear to be underperforming based on current CPU and memory conditions and should be investigated.

data.name: PluralNetworkControllerUseUnsupportedSoftware
data.value: {0} network controllers uses unsupported software that should be upgraded or replaced. Unsupported software no longer receives regular updates to ensure it is protected against the most recent cyber security threats.

data.name: PluralSpecificAreaForReliabilityImprovementInMetasys
data.value: {0} specific areas for reliability improvements were identified within Metasys. These issues can include unreliable points, backup battery issues, excessive alarming, overridden points, dirty filters, overloaded and offline controllers or broken object references. Refer to the section in Site Details for specific issues found on your site.

data.name: ProperlyTunedBuildingProvideEnergySavings
data.value: A properly tuned building automation system can provide between 5-20% energy savings, according to a study by the U.S. Department of Energy (Katipamula et al, “Improving Commercial Building Operations thru Building Re-tuning: Meta-Analysis”, http://buildingretuning.pnnl.gov/documents/pnnl_sa_110686.pdf). Several of the features of Metasys focus on the energy performance and savings of a building. This section provides analysis of your site with regards to these features.

data.name: SecurityIsConcernForAllNetworkSystem
data.value: Security is a growing concern for all networked systems, and Metasys is no exception. A secure Metasys system decreases the likelihood of unauthorized access to the building systems on your site.

data.name: SingleAreaForImprovementIdentified
data.value: 1 specific area for improvement was identified within Metasys regarding the security of your site.

data.value: 1 specific area for improvement was identified within Metasys regarding the security of your site.

A broken object reference indicates that a process (programming logic, schedules, trend studies, graphics, etc.) cannot find an object in the system. The severity of this item depends on the process that cannot find the object it is trying to control.

data.value: While 1 of the HVAC equipments in your building is scheduled, consider reviewing this schedule on a regular basis to ensure it still meets the needs of your facility.

data.name: SingleIndicatorHVACEquipmentDeviatingSetPoint
data.value:
Providing productive environments for building occupants or critical processes is a key function of any BAS system. Metasys monitors temperature and airflow and automates the control of equipment to maintain the desired conditions for your facility.

There are indicators that 1 piece of HVAC equipment in your building may be deviating from desirable set point conditions. This can cause overheating or overcooling of zones. In addition to causing comfort issues or disrupting processes that are temperature dependent, this overheating/ cooling can also be a source of energy waste. It could also be an indicator of equipment issues such as leaking valves, failed electric reheat coils, faulty damper linkages, or faulty sensors.

data.name: SingleInputPointOnAHUConnectedToSensor
data.value: 1 input point on your air handling units is connected to sensors that will continue to require regular service checks to ensure that the sensors in your system stay accurate. Without accurate sensory input, your building control systems may waste energy, decrease your equipment reliability and longevity, and cause occupant discomfort.

data.name: SingleMetasysAlarmEventShouldBeInvestigated
data.value: 1 Metasys alarm or event should be investigated and acknowledged. Excessive alarming could be an indication of equipment issues or other underlying root causes that need to be addressed. Or it could mean your alarm thresholds could be adjusted to produce fewer alarms so that operators can focus on alarms that are true indicators of problems.

data.name: UpgradingAndUpdatingSoftware
data.value: Upgrading and updating software is one of five key security countermeasures recommended by the Department of Homeland Security Control Systems Security Program (https://ics-cert.us-cert.gov/sites/default/files/recommended_practices/DHS%20Bulletin_Feb%202005%20R2_S508C.pdf).

data.name: YourSystemNotAtCurrentVersion
data.value: Your system is not at the current version. Upgrading to the latest version would provide significant security enhancements – including secure, encrypted communications with HTTPS.

data.name: NoNetworkControllerNeedsBatteryReplacement
data.value: No network controller has a battery that needs to be replaced. The battery provides backup power in the case of a power interruption. If the battery is not replaced, you run the risk of data loss or other issues if the power to the controller is interrupted.

data.name: PluralNetworkControllerNeedsBatteryReplacement
data.value: {0} network controllers have a battery that needs to be replaced. The battery provides backup power in the case of a power interruption. If the battery is not replaced, you run the risk of data loss or other issues if the power to the controller is interrupted.

data.name: SingleNetworkControllerNeedsBatteryReplacement
data.value: 1 network controller has a battery that needs to be replaced. The battery provides backup power in the case of a power interruption. If the battery is not replaced, you run the risk of data loss or other issues if the power to the controller is interrupted.

data.name: DeviceNotOperational
data.value: Device status is not 'Operational'.

data.name: DeviceNotOperationalRecom
data.value: Check with power failure, Check network connectivity, Replace with new NCM.

data.name: PluralDeviceNotOperational
data.value: {0} devices are not in 'Operational' state.

data.name: PluralPmiBatteryFault
data.value: {0} devices's battery are faulty.

data.name: ReportPluralDeviceNotOperational
data.value: {0} Network Control Module (NCM) device(s) are not in 'Operational State'.

data.name: ReportPluralPmiBatteryFault
data.value: {0} Network Control Module (NCM) devices have a battery that needs to be replaced. The battery provides backup power in case of a power interruption. If the battery is not replaced, you run the risk of data loss or other issues if the power to the device is interrupted.

data.name: PluralPmiFieldControllerLimitationExceed
data.value: {0} devices exceeds its recommended controller count limitation.

data.name: ReportPluralPmiFieldControllerLimitationExceed
data.value: {0} Network Control Module (NCM) devices exceeded recommended limitation of 100 field controllers on a single N2 trunk.

data.name: PluralPmiObjectsLimitationExceed
data.value: {0} devices exceeds its recommended object count limitation.

data.name: ReportPluralPmiObjectsLimitationExceed
data.value: {0} Network Control Module (NCM) devices exceeded recommended limitation of 1500 objects count per NCM.

data.name: PmiBatteryFault
data.value: Battery is faulty, preventing backup capabilities before restarting.

data.name: PmiBatteryFaultRecom
data.value: Make sure the battery is properly installed. Replace the battery if necessary.

data.name: PmiSiteOlderVersion
data.value: The Metasys PMI site has older Metasys version.

data.name: PmiSiteOlderVersionRecom
data.value: Consider upgrading to the latest version of Metasys. Contact your local sales representative for more information on Metasys.

data.name: SingleDeviceNotOperational
data.value: 1 device is not in 'Operational' state.

data.name: ReportSingleDeviceNotOperational
data.value: 1 Network Control Module (NCM) device is not in 'Operational State'.

data.name: SinglePmiBatteryFault
data.value: 1 device's battery is faulty.

data.name: ReportSinglePmiBatteryFault
data.value: 1 Network Control Module (NCM) device has a battery that needs to be replaced. The battery provides backup power in case of a power interruption. If the battery is not replaced, you run the risk of data loss or other issues if the power to the device is interrupted.

data.name: SinglePmiFieldControllerLimitationExceed
data.value: 1 device exceeds its recommended controller count limitation.

data.name: ReportSinglePmiFieldControllerLimitationExceed
data.value: 1 Network Control Module (NCM) device exceeded recommended limitation of 100 field controllers on a single N2 trunk.

data.name: SinglePmiObjectsLimitationExceed
data.value: 1 device exceeds its recommended object count limitation.

data.name: ReportSinglePmiObjectsLimitationExceed
data.value: 1 Network Control Module (NCM) device exceeded recommended limitation of 1500 objects count per NCM.

data.name: PluralPmiOfflinePollGreaterThanZero
data.value: {0} controllers’ ‘Offline Poll’ is greater than zero.

data.name: ReportPluralPmiOfflinePollGreaterThanZero
data.value: {0} Field Controllers offline poll is greater than zero. This could have a negative effect on the performance of the network.

data.name: PmiOfflinePollGreaterThanZero
data.value: Controller ‘Offline Poll’ is greater than zero.

data.name: SinglePmiOfflinePollGreaterThanZero
data.value: 1 controller's ‘Offline Poll’ is greater than zero.

data.name: ReportSinglePmiOfflinePollGreaterThanZero
data.value: 1 Field Controller offline poll is greater than zero. This could have a negative effect on the performance of the network.

data.name: ReportSupportPmiOfflinePollGreaterThanZero
data.value: Offline devices cause a polling interruption in the network since the NCM waits to determine whether the device is offline. Therefore, each offline device should have minimum polling cycles for the online devices.

data.name: PmiDecompilingErrorFound
data.value: {0} Error(s) of Decompiling found. Perform Export to Excel to view details of error(s) from File Menu.

data.name: SinglePmiDecompilingErrorFound
data.value: 1 NC has Decompiling Error(s).

data.name: ReportSinglePmiDecompilingErrorFound
data.value: 1 Network Control Module (NCM) device has errors during the ddl decompile.

data.name: PluralPmiDecompilingErrorFound
data.value: {0} NCs have Decompiling Errors.

data.name: ReportPluralPmiDecompilingErrorFound
data.value: {0} Network Control Module (NCM) devices have errors during the ddl decompile.

data.name: ReportSupportPmiDecompilingErrorFound
data.value: The DDL decompiler keeps track of archive database errors found during the decompile, and attempts to decompile as much of the archive database as possible, despite errors.

data.name: NoPmiDecompilingErrorFound
data.value: No NC has Decompiling Error(s).

data.name: SingleInventoryReviewConducted

data.name: SingleSpecificAreaForImprovementInMetasysPmi
data.value: 1 specific area for improvement was identified within your Metasys PMI system regarding the maintenance and reliability of your site.

data.name: PluralSpecificAreaForImprovementInMetasysPmi
data.value: {0} specific areas for improvement were identified within your Metasys PMI system regarding the maintenance and reliability of your site.

data.name: NotLatestVersionError
data.value: This site is not at the latest version of Metasys. Contact your local sales representative for upgrade options

data.name: NotLatestVersionErrorDesc
data.value: The latest Metasys release takes this industry-leading building automation system to a new level, further enhancing building efficiency—along with occupant comfort, safety, security and productivity. New capabilities improve space use, cut time on task, ease integrations and enhance network performance.

data.name: UpgradingMetasysSystemBenefits
data.value: Upgrading your Metasys system would provide additional benefits

data.name: UpgradingBenefitFirst
data.value: Intuitive navigation of system by building spaces to clearly communicate equipment relationships for faster troubleshooting and less time on task

data.name: UpgradingBenefitSecond
data.value: Mobile optimized, browser based user interface for access from anywhere, at any time, on any device (no apps or downloads required)

data.name: UpgradingBenefitThird
data.value: Photo-realistic graphics for cleaner visualization, right from your mobile device

data.name: UpgradingBenefitForth
data.value: Standardized MODBUS integration and BACnet® Protocol Revision 12 support for easier integrations with other systems

data.name: UpgradingBenefitFifth
data.value: Ability to collect, summarize, and present building data in relevant and usable ways with Advanced Reporting feature

data.name: UpgradingBenefitSixth
data.value: Ability to focus energy-reduction activities by identifying all similar objects and determining energy outliers with Tailored Summaries feature

data.name: UpgradingBenefitSeventh
data.value: Access to reports that aggregate energy-related data to identify opportunities to reduce energy spend

data.name: UpgradingBenefitEighth
data.value: New BACnet/IP field equipment controllers for increased network performance and to help future-proof building system networks

data.name: UpgradingBenefitNinth
data.value: Significant security enhancements – including secure, encrypted communications with HTTPS – to prevent unauthorized access
